entry.title: Unexpected document Split Clearing Account
entry.content:
If you do direct activity allocation and FI direct posting to WBS of overhead project in s/4hana public cloud and then settle with Ledger: 0L.
Only the amounts posted directly in FI result in 29500100 (Document Split Clearing Account), but is this always happening?

entry.title: Migration cockpit- AA upload function
entry.content:
We are currently experiencing issues with the Migration Cockpit related to asset uploads, as outlined below:

  1. Fixed Asset Posting – Unplanned Depreciation
    In the upload template for Fixed Asset Posting, there is no field available for unplanned depreciation. Could you please advise whether there is an updated template or an alternative function that supports mass upload of unplanned depreciation postings?

  2. Fixed Asset Master Data – Time-Based Valuation
    In the upload template for Fixed Asset Master Data → Time-Based Valuation, we are able to flag the Asset Shutdown indicator. However, we cannot find any column that allows us to input the date interval. We currently need to upload assets with more than one interval period. Could you please advise how this can be achieved using the Migration Cockpit?

Your guidance on the above would be greatly appreciated.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Which SAP IAS tenant should be used for SAP BTP when configuring Joule in S/4HANA Cloud Public?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently working on the configuration of Joule for a project running on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and we have an architecture-related question regarding Identity Authentication Service (IAS).

In our landscape, we have:

  • One IAS Test tenant

  • One IAS Productive tenant

As part of the Joule setup, we also have an SAP BTP tenant included in the project.

Our question is:

Which IAS tenant should be connected to the SAP BTP tenant when implementing Joule?

  • Should SAP BTP be trusted with the IAS Test tenant, or

  • Is it considered best practice to connect SAP BTP directly to the IAS Productive tenant?

Additionally, we would like to understand:

  • What is the recommended SAP best practice for this scenario?

  • Is there a typical approach during implementation phases (test vs. productive)?

  • Are there any considerations specific to S/4HANA Cloud Public + Joule that we should be aware of?

Any guidance, official documentation references, or real-project experience would be greatly appreciated.
We are especially interested in SAP-recommended architectures or official guidance for S/4HANA Cloud Public projects.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
Oscar

entry.title: Custom Reusable elements and Custom Business Objects.
entry.content:
Hello,

I would appreciate your help in sharing your thoughts on the following questions.

1. I've created a Custom Reusable Element, and I'm wondering if it's possible to enable it from the Manage Master Data app.

When I try to call it from Custom Fields, using the Type Code List based on CDs View, the custom reusable element doesn't appear.
Is this possible?

2.I have also created Custom Business Objects, when I try to call it from Custom Fields, using the Type Code List based on CDs View, the Custom Business Objects doesn't appear.

 

Note:
I have reviewed documentation or blogs but I have not been able to find the configuration I need.

I would appreciate your feedback.

Thank you very much.

entry.title: assign the company codes from different countries to a single company in the Public Cloud
entry.content: I have already assigned the Egypt company code to Company 1000 in CBC and the Dubai company code to Company 2000 in CBC. After confirming these assignments, I updated the configuration to assign all company codes to a single company. However, the change is still not reflected in CBC

entry.title: Is it possible to transport custom views in applications?
entry.content:
Dear experts,

Hello!

As I checked software collections, I did not find anything that seems to contain these views so, I was wondering if this can be transported to Q and P sysem.

Thank you in advance!

Fujita

Adrián Ramírez.

entry.title: Track & report reasons for component shortages/spills during goods issue to production
entry.content:
Scenario:
We issue components from warehouse or storage location to the production line for a production order.
Example: the order needs 2 barrels of material BR01, but during internal transport or at the line 1 barrel is spilled/damaged, so production requests an additional issue of 1 barrel BR01.

Requirement:

  1. We want to capture a reason for the additional issue (e.g., spillage, damaged during transport, quantity short at line, quality issue), so it’s traceable per production order/material.

  2. We want a report/analytics to show these reasons over time (e.g., spillage incidents per month, or by production order range / material / production line).

Is there a standard way in SAP public cloud where we can resolve this problem

entry.title: SAP Analytical Queries Previous Year
entry.content:
Good afternoon, SAP Community.

I have a question regarding how to retrieve the previous year based on a user input.

For example, if the user enters a year in the report, how can I derive the previous year’s value (input year − 1) and bind it to the Previous Year column?

This is for a Production report where I need to compare the current year with the previous year.


Thanks and Best

Rawel

entry.title: Material Ledger handling for Group Valuation (4G) when not used functionally - S/4HANA Cloud, Public
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We are reviewing how Material Ledger should be handled when Group Valuation (5W2) is technically active but not required from a business or reporting perspective.

We are aware that Group Valuation cannot be technically deactivated once it is activated.
However, we would like to clarify the behavior specifically from a Material Ledger perspective.

In the current system, Group Valuation will not be used from a business or reporting perspective. There is only one company code in the system, and no group-level valuation is required.

Our question is:
Is there any configuration or recommended approach in Material Ledger to avoid operational processing for the 4G (Group Valuation) ledger, even though Group Valuation remains technically active?

More specifically:

  • Can the Material Ledger be configured so that 4G does not require an actual costing run (CKMLCP) in each period?

  • If CKMLCP must technically run for all ML valuation views, is there a way to execute it in a minimal or neutral way for 4G (for example, without price differences or business impact)?

We are looking for best practices to minimize period-end effort related to Group Valuation when it is not used functionally.

BR,
Evrim

entry.title: Email notifications not triggered for PR Flexible Workflow
entry.content:
We are using SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition and have configured Flexible Workflow for Purchase Requisition (PR) approval.

Issue Description:

The PR approval workflow is triggered correctly, and approver determination works as expected. Approvers receive approval tasks in My Inbox, and workflow processing functions normally. However, email notifications are not consistently triggered, and the Notification / Email tab is not visible in the Flexible Workflow configuration for Purchase Requisitions.

Expected System Behavior:

  1. When a PR is created and submitted for approval:
    • The approver should receive a workflow task in My Inbox.
    • The approver should also receive an email notification informing them of the pending approval.
  3. After the PR is approved or rejected:
    • The PR initiator should receive a system notification.
    • The PR initiator should also receive an email notification confirming the approval or rejection.

Actual System Behavior:

  • Workflow triggers correctly.
  • Approval task is created and visible in My Inbox.
  • Approver determination is correct.
  • Email notifications are not triggered.
  • Email tab is not available in the Flexible Workflow app for PRs.

Steps to Reproduce:

  1. Create a Purchase Requisition that meets the workflow start condition.
  2. Submit the PR.
  3. Workflow is triggered and approval task is created.
  4. Approver receives task in My Inbox.
  5. No email notification is received by the approver.
  6. After approval, no email notification is received by the PR initiator.

System Information:

  • Deployment: SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition
  • Application: Flexible Workflow for Purchase Requisitions
  • Fiori App: Manage Workflows for Purchase Requisitions

Request:

Kindly confirm:

  • Whether email notifications for PR Flexible Workflow are supported in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition.
  • Whether the absence of the Notification / Email tab in PR Flexible Workflow is standard system behavior.
  • If email notifications are supported, please advise the required configuration or prerequisites.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Partial GI & Splitting ODO in S/4 HANA Public Cloud Embedded EWM
entry.content:
1. We have a S/4 HANA Public Cloud Embedded EWM on BOBM, is there a possibility of posting partial goods issue against the Outbound Delivery Order (ODO) in the manage outbound delivery orders screen or through warehouse monitor, wherein we pick only a portion of the quantity of the ODO through a warehouse task and try to post GI.
  2. Is there a way to split the Outbound Delivery received from the ERP before creating the warehouse tasks in EWM. The Outbound deliveries are created from the Sales Schedule lines
    Screenshots:

Issue 1: Trying to post Partial GI - When we pick partially and try to post partial Goods Issue, system is not allowing. Is there a work around to avoid this standard behavior and post partial GI for Outbound Delivery Orders in EWM?
 
Issue 2: The current splitting functionality in EWM Warehouse Monitor is expecting me to create Warehouse Tasks for the entire ODO qty and then delete a task to create a split delivery. Is there a way to split the delivery before even creating the warehouse tasks in EWM. 

VLSP-Split Outbound Delivery transaction also can’t be used, as it creates an error since the delivery was already distributed to EWM.

Kindly suggest options/work arounds for Splitting Outbound Delivery Orders and Posting Partial Goods Issue.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP public cloud custom po header condition for freight & insurance
entry.content:
Hi All,

Need some assistance in my custom PO header condition created. I have created a custom freight & insurance PO condition for header.

ZFIN- New condition

I have added the total freight for the PO as 50 in the Amount column. But in the Condition value it is changing the value to 100, since there are two lines in the PO as shown above. Is this correct?

Also, once I add the amount in the PO header condition, it is not proportionately dividing against each line as shown below. Same 50 is automatically added for both lines.

can some please assist to guide if this is the correct way or if not how to rectify.

Thank you

entry.title: Custom CDS Analytical Query: Some fields have no selectable values in filter bar – Value Help relate
entry.content:
Hi SAP experts,

I am facing an issue with custom CDS analytical reports (Query) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

In my custom CDS query, I noticed that some fields can be used as filters but have no selectable values in the filter bar, while other fields work fine and provide value help automatically.

Example

1.No selectable values in filter bar：I_ProductionOrderItem._ProductionOrderHeader.ProductionSupervisor

2.Selectable values available：I_ProductionOrder._ProductionOrderItem.OrderIsReleased

Both fields are exposed in the CDS query and marked as selectable filters, but their behavior in the filter bar is different.

Questions

1.What are the mandatory requirements for a CDS field to have selectable values in the filter bar?

2.Why do some standard fields (like OrderIsReleased) automatically have value help, while others (like ProductionSupervisor) do not?

3.How to make ProductionSupervisor show selectable values in the filter bar?

 

Any guidance or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!
